Missoula.University of Montana College of Forestr:
== History ==
The School of Forestry was created by an act of the Thirteenth Montanan Legislative Assembly in 1913 to meet the great and growing demand on the part of lumber companies, large timber holding corporations, and the national and state governments.


== Laboratories and Stations ==
The College of Forestry and Conservation has access to well-equipped laboratories, extensive computer technology, and four field stations --
the 28,000-acre (110 km2) Lubrecht Experimental Forest
the Flathead Lake Biological Station on the shores of 184-square-mile (480 km2) Flathead Lake
the 3,500-acre (14 km2) Bandy Ranch
the Boone and Crockett Club's Theodore Roosevelt Memorial Ranch of 6,000 acres (24 km2) along the east face of the Rockies.


== Program ==
The College of Forestry and Conservation is currently ranked number one in the country.
